intro: Heptapleurum gigantifolium, commonly known as the giant-leaf heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Actinidiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, leathery leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by edible berries. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
